c:article.c:title: Write a todo list with Express and MongoDB
c:article.c:abstract: A todo list website is a good practice to learn a programing language or a framework. It shows you how to create, read, update and delete records. In this post we are going to use Express as our application framework and MongoDB as our data store.

c:article.c:title: Responsive Equal Height Blocks
c:article.c:abstract: It's virtually dividing the list into rows, picking the height of the highest item in each row, and setting it for the other corresponding row items in a responsive way

c:article.c:title: PluralSight
c:article.c:abstract: PluralSight has video courses. The reason why I like it so much is because it is much easier for me to remember things when I see them. Plus, the tutorials are given by seasoned professionals who will also give a few tricks that they’ve learned along the way.

c:article.c:title: Restive.JS
c:article.c:abstract:
Restive.JS is a lightweight JQuery Framework (note the JQuery dependency) that allows developers to better handle responsive design. It provides a bunch of useful classes and identifiers that makes it easier for developers to target specific widths, orientations, even devices. Please have a look, I find it very exciting.
http://speckyboy.com/2014/04/24/make-any-website-responsive/
